dict.string: Incite or support, encourage (usually an offender or the commission of an offence)
The judge ruled Mr. Cornwell guilty of aiding and abetting the main accused in the bank-robbery case.
With the pace of life in Indian metros getting faster by the day, many of the old Indian traditions have fallen into abeyance and are no longer practiced.
Sunk to a low condition, Degraded
Within a space of five years, the Orchard family was transformed from a state of plentiful extravagance to one of abject poverty.
To deny, To abandon one's claim or right
John has legally abjured himself from his father's wealth, saying that he is not interested in inheriting money that has been earned unscrupulously
Lack of concern for one's own wishes
According to some religious preachers, self-abnegation is the only route to a state of unlimited happiness
